strings.Value: "You can't use a living creature as a target — even an enemy. Let this kobold go!"
"You may capture or kill your enemies, but do not torment them. Finish him off, and no more torture."
"A contest? I'm in! It's always more interesting with a live target."
[Attack] "Enough. I'll endure this alliance no longer!"
"I will not take part in this. Farewell!"
"His shouts... His screams of pain... They're like music to Zon-Kuthon's ears!"
"Greeting ally! We train aim! Best get reward! You play too, yes?"
{n}You hit the target. The kobold emits a woeful hiss, and the mites cheer.{/n} "Ahahaha! Sweet! We reward you, ally!"
{n}You miss. The kobold hisses. The mites cheer.{/n} "Miss! You catch kobold and train, ally!"
{n}The mites grumble, annoyed.{/n} "You friend our beautiful queen. We listen you. We catch other kobold anyway!"
{n}The mites are surprised.{/n} "How we train aim if kobold dead? Fine. We kill this and catch new!"
{n}Octavia winces.{/n} "I've seen noble, rich, educated people with the same tastes in entertainment. Scales and fangs would suit them far better than velvet and satin."
"Hey, girl, cheer up! I know at least two who will never wear anything again — except their fine wooden boxes!"
"Haha, 'tis true! But so many still enjoy life... I wish we could send them all down here, among the mites and kobolds!"

"Yes! Killing him in battle would be one thing, but like this..." {n}Octavia stops herself and waves a hand.{/n} "Oh, who am I lecturing? They probably don't even know those words. But still — thanks for stopping it."
